subject: Ethics
title: Health Data Monetization
description: A fast breakdown of Health Data Monetization for builders.

hook.text: Your pharmacy app knows your prescriptions. Your fitness tracker knows your heart rate. Both can sell that data.

buildup.text: Health data is among the most valuable on the market. Insurers, employers, and advertisers all want it.

discovery.text: HIPAA protects data your doctor holds â€” but not data from health apps, wearables, or period trackers.

twist.text: After Roe v. Wade was overturned, period tracking data became potential evidence. Users had no legal shield.

climax.text: The gap between medical privacy law and health tech means your most sensitive data has the least protection.

punchline.text: Your doctor can't share your data. Your app can.

quiz.question: Why is health app data less protected than hospital records?
options: Apps use better encryption than hospitals
Health app data is always anonymized first
HIPAA doesn't cover most health apps and wearables
